title: Cheating on my FWB: is that possible? - m4w
text:
So I've been FWB with this woman for a few years. We met online and she made it clear she didn't want a long term relationship, she had just gotten out of her marriage and was just looking for friends to do things with. After a few platonic dates, I went over to her house one night and suddenly it was 3 am and her shirt was unbuttoned. 

We decided that we had been having a pretty good time together, and the night on the couch hinted at some additional possibilities. She allowed as how she might be interested in a FWB kind of relationship, nothing serious or permanent. In fact, she was planning on moving once her kids were out of school, and I was not in a position to do the same. All in all, my own situation was such that this FWB thing seemed like a good idea. 

And now it's three years later and we're still FWB. But... our definition seems to be different. She's content with seeing me once or twice a month, between her job and her kids, she just doesn't have time for more. I, on the other hand, well, you know. And yet she expects this to be an exclusive arrangement. This sort of sounds like a lot of marriages, does't it. LMAO. 

I've never seen the word 'exclusive' used in any definition of FWB, yet at the same time, I'm having trouble cheating on her. I DID see a couple of other women early on in our relationship, but just a bit, and nothing more than a bit of fooling around. And even that stopped a while ago. 

I'm posting out of town, so this is completely anonymous. We can talk completely freely. 

Thoughts?

title: Seeking an intelligent, honest, grown up
text:
My ex has visitation with my daughter for the weekend so that leaves me alone with no plans the next couple of days. I would greatly appreciate a chance to fill some of that time with an adult woman. 

What follows is a posting I have placed in the past. It includes a lot of information about who I am, the type of woman I would like to find, and how I would like to spend the time. If it resonates with you, I would be grateful for a reply. Near the end of the posting there are requested specifics as to a reply. Please respond accordingly. I hope someone out there feels the same. 


**********


So who is the man behind this post? I have been divorced more than ten years, haven't even been on a casual date in over three years because of other priorities. I have put my daughter first, my extended family and students next, and have gradually lost contact with old friends over the years. Visitation nights and weekends, while my daughter is away, have becoming increasingly lonely. I am straight laced and conservative. I don't smoke. I don't drink. I have never used any type of recreational drug. I have never had an STD of any kind, and I do not want to start now. I am particular about who I spend my time with.

So who is the type of woman I would like to meet through this post? I would prefer to meet someone who is also lonely, who like me has spent years without an intimate touch. I would prefer to meet a "grown up" who has her life in order, perhaps in her late 30s or 40s. Someone who is stable both emotionally and financially, but misses having someone appreciate her. I would prefer someone who is educated and intelligent to very intelligent. And to be perfectly honest, I would *prefer* someone who is at least cute to me. I realize that is subjective, photos would be appreciated but are not necessarily required until we have exchanged a few messages to build some comfort level.

I am careful, and picky, about who I spend my time with, which is the primary reason I haven't been intimate in over three years. I would not be interested in someone who "gets around" and dates multiple men or has been sexually active with someone recently. There is nothing "casual" about what I seek.

Why am I searching on Craigslist? I do very much miss having an adult woman in my life. I miss the company, the conversations, and so much more... 

I miss holding a woman in my arms, whether it is a long sweet hug in public, or something much more intimate in private. I miss feeling arms wrapped around me, the light scent of shampoo from her hair, and a faint hint of perfume. I miss the feel of a body pressed against me and knowing she has chosen me to share her affection.

I miss a kiss, from a short peck on the cheek or forehead to a long, slow, wet kiss that lasts for minutes that seem like seconds. I miss nuzzling a woman's neck, nibbling her earlobe, lightly taking her bottom lip between mine and tracing along its curve with the tip of my tongue.

I miss having the chance to caress a woman's body, just holding her with an arm around her shoulder while she leans into me, or stroking the inside of her knee and thigh with the tips of my fingers, as we sit side by side at a movie. I miss laying next to a woman and petting her back and the curve of her hip, softly squeezing her bottom in my hand, cupping a breast. I miss pleasing a woman with an intimate touch. I miss so many things about having someone special in my life.

In the past I was told I had "good hands." A few years ago I had a woman tell me she had never been touched that way before, that no one had ever helped her body feel that way before. The last woman I was with, also years ago, told me now she "finally understands what all the fuss is about." I miss pleasing a woman with my touch. I miss feeling her body react, I miss hearing her gasp with pleasure. I miss feeling useful that way. I miss feeling wanted.

Of course I miss pleasure of my own. I miss being touched. I miss feeling a woman's lips press against me. I miss that intimate kiss. I miss feeling a woman press against me and feeling her body move around me. I miss sharing that release. And I do miss holding her afterward, feeling her breathe as she presses close to me, satisfied, happy, and content.

I have no interest in "using" someone to satisfy my desires. I won't pay for temporary company. If I am going to do this I want a shared experience which is mutually satisfying. I want the woman I am with to feel things she has never felt, to experience things she has never experienced, to be satisfied in ways she has never been satisfied. I want her to enjoy the time she spends with me so much that she can't wait to see me again. I want her to ask for my company and my touch. That may seem unrealistic, but it is my goal. I am not looking for one quick encounter. I would like to spend hours together, and my hope is we could develop an ongoing intimate relationship.

There are so many things I miss... and I would be willing to continue to discuss them in greater detail should you honor me with an e-mail and we have a mutual interest in continuing communication, but I hope to find someone who wants to act on those discussions, not just have an e-mail friend.

I am at a point in my life where I would truly appreciate the opportunity to spend time with an attractive, fun, adult woman. I would not take that for granted and would do my best to make sure someone I am attracted to knows she is appreciated (not with lavish gifts, but with all the "little things" that let her know I am grateful for her company.)

I am confident in my intellect, in the fact I am a good father, in my ability to teach complex topics, and in my bedroom skills; but I have always been shy when it comes to an initial introduction, so here I am searching online instead of out approaching someone somewhere face-to-face. Clubs or bars have never interested me, at work is out of the question, "hitting on" someone at church, or even a store or in the mall, seems grossly inappropriate to me, where do like minded adults meet?

If you feel you fit the short list of preferences I mentioned above and anything I have written appeals to you, I would sincerely welcome an e-mail from you. 

If you have read this far, so as not to mislead anyone, I will also mention I am overweight. If my size is a deal breaker for some women, I completely understand. I would rather be honest in advance than see a look of disappoint from someone if we do have the opportunity to meet in person. If you can overlook that flaw I think you will be amazed by the person I am. I am Caucasian, six feet tall, hold a masters degree, and would be willing to discuss other details via e-mail.

Again, if you are even mildly curious or interested in what I have written, I would be very grateful to hear from you. To separate your message from the automated responses and scams, please mention something personal, like your name or preferred nickname, or the city where you live or work, in the subject line of your e-mail message.

Please send more than one or two lines, or one or two paragraphs. Don't just say you agree with what I wrote and feel the same way. Please take the time to tell me how *you* feel, what *you* miss, in your own words. Help me get to know who you are in your reply. What is your background, education, career, family status? I do realize there is nothing more frustrating than being ignored. If anyone does take the time to send a proper message, I will respond (other than obvious spam.) 

Thank you for taking the time to read my post. If you are willing to give me the chance, I will try to make you happy you took the risk.

I'm decently attractive I think. I'm not exactly going to make you swoon at a single glance, but I have my charm. I have an average build leaning a little towards the chubby side. An intimate friend described me as "soft". Being soft makes me perfect cuddle material apparently. Which is a good thing, since I love cuddling.

I like to think I have my shit together, and compared to some people that is definitely the case. I work, own a car, and rent a house with my roommates, which are all things adults are supposed do apparently. Growing up was definitely one of the biggest mistakes of my life, but it does have its perks. All joking aside, I'm an adult that gets out of bed (eventually), goes to work (regretfully), and comes home to relax with some video games (happily).

My sense of humor can most often be found in the gutter (slumming it up with my friends). I'm definitely nerdy and dirty, so if you're into trying something kinky I'm your guy. I think I'd probably only be happy in a relationship with someone that shared my kinky hobbies. They say opposites attract, but I think having a firm foundation of common interests trumps that old adage. Besides, what gamer worth his salt doesn't want a gamer girlfriend? If you've liked what you've read, and fit the paragraph above, then please feel free to hit that reply button. If I'm awake I'll reply fairly quickly (hurrah for smart phones!). In your message, just tell me a little bit about yourself (do you like cats?), include a picture (it's only fair since you already know what I look like), and change the subject to something interesting (maybe your favorite game?). title: Looking for that Black Bottom that is made for me
text:
Let me straight honest, in my heart I want nothing more than to find someone to love, commit myself to, and be with until the day I die. I want to finally experience the elusive love that I have watched everyone around me attain; I've been so close, yet, I feel so removed from it. 

For the right person, I am willing to do whatever is necessary in order to meet him. If he lives on pluto, I will build a rocket, spend ten years flying there and ten back just to bring him here with me. I am posting across the country in hopes of finding someone who feels the same and is interested in exploring each other for the purposes of a relationship. I am a Christian, faithful, loving, caring, romantic, sweet, kind, honest, attractive, and giving man. 

If you could imagine how the perfect husband would act and treat you, it would be me. All my life, I have dreamed of finding that one guy who I could share my everything with and love forever. I know how silly this must sound, considering popular gay culture, but there must be at least one more out there like me. I know you're out there, and I'm waiting. 

I'm a graduate student, heading into a great profession. I am educated, financially stable, with my own place and my own vehicle. I don't mind if you aren't as "set" as I am, what I care about is our connection. 

I want to meet someone who will give me the time to get to know him to see if he is the one. I thought at one point that love at first sight happens, but I've learned a lot about people and what love really is over the past couple of years. Love means giving up things you need for someone else's wants. Love means doing what's best for both of you. Love means you can't imagine your life without someone. 

Maybe you're just like me, you desire that one person who will cherish you for the rest of your life. Do you fantasize about that one guy who will hold you throughout the night, waking up to make sure you are pressed tightly against him and that you're safe? He would hold your hand all the time, take you on the best dates, and make you wonder where in the hell he has been your entire life. He would grasp you in ways that make you feel alive and show you how much you are wanted and needed. 

He would come to your rescue when you need him and show you everyday he is worthy and deserving of your entire heart and all of your devotion. I am that guy. I dream about doing all of those things for someone. It's the thing I desire most on this planet. I'm tired of only imagining my fairytale, I'm ready to live it. 

I know if you have read this far that you are wondering what I look like and what I like. . . right? Well, I am of average height (5'10"), I am burley, but I carry my weight well, very attractive, of mixed race, although I essentially am (look) white. I am a top and tend to fill the more classic "guy" role in a relationship. 

I also have an inclination to gravitate more towards black men who are shorter, thinner, and hairless, but my tendencies are in no way reflective of any "absolutes" placed on the guys I want to meet, but I will be as honest as possible and tell you that I find it highly unlikely that I will find someone who isn't black attractive. Furthermore, ideally I would prefer someone who is a virgin or has a minimal number of sexual partners. 

I must be completely honest when I say I have been hurt before. I have never experienced what one would call a "good" relationship. I have had my heart trampled on and beaten until I thought it wouldn't be able to recover. I have everything I want besides this. It pains me a lot to experience each day alone and without the love I am so tirelessly praying for. I am hoping that the one guy, just one, in all of this nation, will see me and love me. I am hoping that he will finally provide me with the security and love I need to reach my true self. When I am with someone who gives me the love, attention, and security that I have never had, I have the potential to be everything you could ever want, hope for, and dream about. I am still trying to get over the past, but I need someone to show me what love should be so I can finally let go of it and experience all that love has to offer. 

Maybe I want too much from a man, but I feel like I deserve it. Guys fear commitment, love, everything having to do with getting close to another human. Love isn't logical and doesn't follow anything else. In fact, it goes against biology completely, but I believe that when I find mine, he will know me when he sees me- he will be ready to love me in my entirety and give me all of his heart. 


***********************************

I am still trying to get over the past, but I need someone to show me what love should be so I can finally let go of it and experience all that love has to offer.

title: Why is Abilene on the hit list?
text:
I just discovered this rant section. What a great idea it is!

Abilene sucks. When I was a boy there in the 1970s, I found Abilene to be a horrible place full of violent, angry humans. Being a weak skinny toothpick in stature, I got my ass kicked by Abilene's teachers, bully school kids, and, when home, by family members and neighborhood bullies.

My drunk Army sergeant pappy was gone before I was 8. Too bad Ho Chi Minh didn't shoot him. My mammy, in order to escape her drunk mammy and the orphanage, hooked up with the first bastard that pawed at her. We four kids were bargaining chips that my mammy used to secure herself that steady Army paycheck, free military doctors, and a ride out of Pennsylvania. (For my pappy insisted on kids as a condition of marriage.)

After having his way, daddy-o dumped us five in Abilene to scrap for a living. Boy was my mammy pissed, and she took it out on her kids, but mostly me. Every day, in concert with Abilene, she was beating me for something, telling me that I was stupid, taking any money I might have earned from odd jobs. Mammy, along with Abilene, firmly implanted her poison in my heart. Abilene taught me vocabulary and attitudes that included nigger, beaner, faggot, kike. My school grades suffered. I was barely literate and emotionally retarded by high school graduation. I had an explosive temper. I was cruel to animals. I stuttered badly. I trusted nobody. I was never told I had value. I was never taught some sort of inventory of survival skills with which I could navigate the adult world. And how could my mammy do the latter? She was a dropout, and her best financial move was fucking my pappy. I was left out, despised, laughed at.

There was never any help for me, even though some Abilene adults knew about my suffering. They were too apathetic to do anything about it. I was left to think something was genuinely wrong with me, deserving of the punishment.

I escaped Abilene by enlisting in the military. I was gone for decades, moving about the USA, gathering experience, skills, learning, judgement, wisdom, maturity, healing. I earned a degree in science.

One day out of the blue I got a letter in the mail from mammy. She needed help. Can you believe that shit? She kicks my ass, and now she's crying for her son? I returned to Abilene, seeking some answers, wondering if I had any family that gave half a damn about me. Boy what a mistake that was! My mammy's only interest in me was my labor and my money, picking her bitching up where she left off when I was 14. And Abilene was just as shitty as ever.

I was there for two winters, working at a few places, scrubbing potties at a college on the south side, building boats, taught some in the public schools, and machining sprockets. Man, do you people have serious problems conducting your daily business. You bastards ran me off those huge, nearly empty boulevards as I bicycled to work every morning. Racial and religious bigotry hang in the Abilene air like a foul stench. Every boss was on a belligerent power trip, demanding that I work overtime upon command, that I do the work of other lazy people in addition to my own workload. I gave excellent quality labor and lots of it for the minimum wage you maggots paid me. I anticipated needs. I offered good ideas that would improve the workplace production. I offered to transmit my skills to improve my peer's efficacy. But you bastards immediately rejected, being too comfortable in your mediocrity and failure. You never thanked me once, spending your energy instead on finding some flaw about which to bitch. You denied me my earned benefits. You destroyed any progress I made for you. You would say the most hostile things about an employee when they left the room. You were unable to conduct the most basic workplace functions on any civil level.

Fantastically, you go to church on Sunday and pray to a god of love for wisdom, compassion, and to be his instrument of good will. On Monday morning, you're back at each others' throats. Never once did I meet anybody there that had any level of learning, curiosity, ability, or deportment that inspired me to listen and learn. Instead, I found the "Friendly Frontier" to be populated with slaves to the great triumvirate of American life: the next line of credit, the next can of beer, and getting your ding dong damp.

In 2008, I took my leave, letting cancer do to my mammy, Charlotte Stout, what I have long, long wanted to do to her for grinding up a terrified, defenceless boy, leaving him to repair all that damage on his own at ruinous expense, but the law prevented. Now, I viciously wish cancer and diabetes upon you obese rodents as your open social sewer decays in infrastructure and economics; as the Wal Marts and Exxons of the world suck away your capital assets; as organized religion snuffs out your spirit; as the jaws of your mental poverty grip you with dissatisfaction, boredom, and fear; and as a corrupt draconian political body, city, county, and state levels, cripples your future.

Don't think I stomp around the earth a hurting victim/survivor of you; you can't have that kind of power over me. Be sure, I'm laughing at you. I laugh when I hear about your floods. I laugh at your religion when I recall the three girls I knew that were raped by your Sunday school teachers. (Two were sisters whose rapist was their father. The Nazarene church there kept him in the organization while keeping the girls quiet by blaming them. Your cowardly civil authorities knew about it but did nothing.) I laugh when I hear about your anti-abortion Nazis tightening the noose of theocratic health policies around your women's necks. I laugh when your public officials take your tax money and give it to illegal aliens. I laugh when the sons and daughters of Texas are raped and shot in our military as they participate in our barbaric wars. (The American military is a safe haven for sexual predators. And not just the female soldiers get raped. So, when Johnny comes marching home, check his butthole for government grants; he may have been some gunny sergeant's bitch.) I laugh when I hear about your teen aged vandals rampaging in the midnight streets, tearing up your property. I laugh at the common Abilenian that hemorrhages his money into mortgages, car loans, credit card debt, insurance policies, child support, divorce, and all sorts of foolish pleasures. This anchors you to your jobs and your abusive employers. I do not waste my money on such things; I save it. This makes it easy for me to trash a thuggish boss, go slurp coffee at a peaceful shop, then find another job at my leisure. I draw my job security from my rich reservoir of talent and ability to adapt. I laugh the laugh of a free man that speaks his mind and moves about as he pleases.

I marvel at my ability to repair a jet engine; to rebuild a diesel engine; to rewire, re-plumb, remodel a house; to quickly learn computers, machining, or any other discipline that might interest me. I honed my cooking and baking skills in the restaurant industry. I'm a highly skilled carpet cleaner. I can lay a floor finish worthy of Buckingham Palace. I'm proud to say that I can intelligently discuss history, art, and science. And I enjoy my abilities to use my simple tool box to turn the things you throw away into cash. I am always absorbing good ideas and superior philosophies. My narcotic is learning.

I'm happy. Your misery is quite palpable, on the other hand. You have earned one another's company.

In this letter you have your answer to why those Mideastern gunmen are shooting at you and have you on their hit list. You export your belligerence to foreign people who have wronged you less than I have then brag about the power of your bombers. Why, I am of the mind to email Abilene's longitude and latitude to Iran in anticipation of their nuclear capabilities. Don't get the idea that I'm just one of those crazed Columbine shooters. That's small potatoes. McVeigh and 9/11 were small potatoes. I do not bother with such minutiae. I want to see Abilene get incinerated under Hell's nuclear mushroom cloud, the ashes stuffed into a cannon and shot into deep space. Alas, I won't have much luck with that. Abilene can't compete with the too many juicy American targets in terrorists' gunsights. 

Perhaps my high school vocabulary and composition slipped your inbred brains. So, then, let me close with a nugget of verbiage Abilene taught me long ago that you're sure to get: fuck you all.

Keith

title: Ode to my friend.
text: Ode to my friend. His name was Robert (Bob) Thorman. He died all alone 12-30-15. How did I know bob? Well, after both of us came back from overseas (I was a Sp and he was in Aircraft maint....b-52's.) we met on the flight line and became instant friends. Bob was from Massachusetts. We decided that living in the barracks after living like kings overseas..if you know what I mean...was not for us. We got a two bedroom house on Peach. I left again overseas and we lost touch. A couple of years ago, I was in "a town" and saw him in a walmart. "Bob?" We renewed our friendship. Lol...I was so jealous of bob when he met a latina in the area (Patsy, Candy?....too many years) she was a doll. When I heard they got married I was so happy for him. Then...his PTSD caused strife and they broke up after a few years. For the last two years, I watch bob struggle with life. Yea, I got PTSD too...and I'm a fuck up. Note: PTSD is not a mental disorder..it's an anxiety disorder....I don't want to hurt anyone and nither do most of us. Managed to do something with my life (college on gi bill, etc) but still it all boils down to I'm still a fuck up. Drink in private.. Bob struggled more than others. I would go by the house when in town (I live somewhere else but deep roots in Taylor county...graduated HS in Taylor county) phone calls just to check up on him. In december, lots of drama in my life so I could only call or text him. Last week while in town...calls went unanswered, when I went to the house, no answer to the knock on door. Cars there. I contacted the PD for a check welfare. It's then the police officer called me....Bob died all alone dec 30. So many people don't understand us. The military...depending on your job (pardon my language) will fuck you up. I have had several friends and relatives turn their back on me. Still standing. I will always stand. Anyway...here's to you bob. As I write this I am sipping on some "JD" thinking of you. You were one hell of a guy, with all your faults. Funny, I recall calling each other "forrest gump." This is the third close friend "back in the day ...military" to loose his life to the "black dog" as Winston Churchill called it. RIP bob....I miss you. I miss all of our talks about "back in the day." It haunts me that someday...I might end up like you ...all alone dying with nobody there. Why do people hate us so much? I was just a little kid, raised the right hand, took the oath and flew away. You did too. Rest my friend. P. Yes, sometime I think (and bob did too) we can just fuck off and die..and nobody gives a damn. No sympathy required....I was a grunt...a grunt can take anything. Anything. Peace. Love you bob. Hope there's a heaven (yea I grew up in church....I think there is.) see you up there bud. WE been through hell, a loving God got to give us a break.

title: Education Expenses
text:
gofund.me/BsEducation

My mother, one of 3 children, was afflicted with juvenile rheumatoid arthritis. She later received an MS diagnosis and a result was dependent on public assistance. These illnesses prevented her from completing her education.
I was born pre-mature; battling asthma and Cerebral Palsy in the form of spastic diaplegia which was corrected partially with surgery at age 7. I was recognized as an Easter Seals poster child. I grew up in Austin, primarily in lower income neighborhoods on the East Side of town, before moving to San Marcos where I completed high school, and took my first computer programming and networking courses.
I started work as a programmer in Visual Basic for Alex Robinson, designing the front-end for an Autolisp program attached to AutoCAD. I moved on to technical support for Telenetwork INC where I later became a second level technician, where I supervised a shift of other technicians and took escalated calls, including commercial ones. I have invested and sold stock across the duration of my working life. 
I became a homeowner at age 27. I achieved Phi Theta Kappa honors at Lone Star Community College while working for Support.com, during which time I was in the top 25% of the company, even achieving the top spot for my department. My philosophy major at Angelo State University has saturated me in logic and argument, as well as my participation in a philosophical discussion club. I was part of a 2015 Community and Engagement reflection project, and attended multiple lectures outside of my major. I minored in history, which exposed me to much detailed research, the use of peer-reviewed journals, and the background of many issues. 
I have five publication credits in creative writing. I also maintain a website, have marketed and produced satirical art, and have several self published books in the works. I have yet to take the LSAT. I am currently pursuing clep credit in business, and investigating a reverse transfer into a AAS networking program either before or after my bachelor's degree. 
My interest in law was kindled by my friendships among my fellow blue-collar workers. I saw many of the legal situations which they found themselves in. The proletarian is legally disarmed for the class warfare that was declared on them. My father, a graduate of Texas State University, became a central member in the peaceful streets project.
I am interested in becoming a defense attorney, who will engage in pro bono work and hopefully become a public defender. I intend to volunteer for various grass-roots organizations as much as possible to give the lower-income bracket access to legal services where applicable. I would like to help tenants, debtors, employees if at all possible during my legal career.
I intend to complete my senior year at Texas Tech University before going to law school.

title: How things have changed in 20 years(not for the better)
text: I am a born and raised Abilenian and have just moved back to Abilene after living elsewhere for the past 20+ years. I moved backed here because of family ties and lifelong friends. I must say I am disappointed in how some things have changed. I do see some things that have improved for the better but many people and businesses seem to have lost their sense of pride in their properties. I have noticed in the past few months that many people no longer take pride in their lawns, they park on their lawns, don't bother to pick up trash, don't keep the grass cut and haven't cut down dead/diseased trees. I realize the economy is down at the moment but just because some are poor doesn't mean you cannot take a little pride in the appearance of the place they live and the local community. Abilene has always had many poor people but they used to take pride in their yards, they planted flowers, kept their grass mowed and kept their homes painted. I know that many of the disabled and elderly cannot do this for themselves but it seems like that helping our neighbors would be a good service project for the Churches and other civic groups to help those in need. These churches that seem more interested in helping migrants need to re-evaluate helping people already living in Abilene and the area, How about helping the homeless and our veterans first. I am not saying not to help the migrants but lets take of our own first. I am helping an elderly person mow their lawn and with some painting, what can you do?

title: life!
text:
I've been feeling down in the dump lately because my life hasn't turned out the way I expected. I realize now I am my own worse enemy. I sit & think about where my life is vs where I thought I was going to be. When I first started my "adult" life I never imagined I'd be divorced with a child, not having completed my degree & not having my own place at the age of 32!
Sometimes I feel like I'll never find love again, I even feel like I am undeserving of love sometimes & I'll be alone forever.
Then I stop, think about what crazy & insane life I've lived & the wonderful people I've encountered.
My greatest enemy is truly myself, why do I feel the need to compare myself to others or even compare my current life with the life I thought I was going to have when I was 18!!
I should be grateful for the fact that I have a beautiful child, have somewhat of a healthy life, the mere fact I am alive & not on drugs or dependent on alcohol! (trust me it's a big deal!!)

title: She's never yours, it's just your turn...
text:
Imagine that over half of all marriages end in divorce. Then think of the percentage where men/women are cheating on their SO. Then the percentage of dead bedrooms and marriages staying alive because of the kids. Then the percentage of marriages not ending because the financial burden it will cause. There's maybe 10-15% good, healthy marriages out there. Fuck that. I'd rather put 50% of my net worth on a hand of Blackjack.

Thats why LTR's are a waste of time. When the excuses start rolling just bounce. Nothing left to talk about. Even if the excuses were valid it doesn't matter. A females primary worth is sex. If she cant deliver that, then she isn't worth having anymore. When the cow is out of milk, you get a new cow. You don't feed the useless cow for 20 more years out of the goodness of your own heart. Its just business.

Women will always want the opposite of whatever they currently have. In a stable LTR? She wants to go out to the bars/clubs and ride the cock carousel. CC rider who spends her weekends at bars? She wants to cuddle at home and watch Netflix. But as soon as they get what they want, they flip once again. This all comes down to the fact that women need two things in their lives - thrill and stability. Once they've got one, they desperately crave the other. The housewives stuck at home with screaming toddlers and Dora the Explorer are seeing Instagrammed club-hopping sluts come up on their Facebook newsfeeds, and craving that exhilarating lifestyle full of bottle service and dark triad dicks. Meanwhile, the Instagram sluts are seeing the housewives posting wine night pictures with the hubby, and craving the security that comes with having a man in their life longterm. That's what it's like being a woman - there's always greener grass on the other side of the fence, and they're constantly seeking a balance between these two pushing and pulling forces.

So the solution for many a hypergamous hamster is to lockdown the bux, then see what kind of strange she can get on the side. The best thing you can do, as a man, is just be thrilling. Easier said than done, I know, but if you slip up, you'd better believe she's going to be seeking out someone else like him for a quick, easy dicking.

Marriage is the Sword of Damocles with no reward attached to the risk.

Women inadvertently tell you their success (or lack thereof) with men when they talk. If they've played slut game and lost (and they usually do), they've had their psyche fractured and generally become "broken women". They've been pumped and dumped at will and are no longer viable in the relationship marketplace.

These broken baggage-filled whores are known by their common sayings:

"Where are all the good men at?" (i spent my 20s willfully getting fucked by the wrong kind of man)

"Why is it so hard to find a man who doesn't cheat?" (I dated guys out of my league and they pursued their options when I foolishly expected exclusivity)

"Men are dogs/pigs/jerks" (I've chosen the wrong guys and they mistreated me as anyone could predict they would)

"Why is it that all the men I'm interested in, don't notice me. Only the guys I don't want hit on me." (I don't understand the basic notion of a 'marketplace', my looks, and the idea of an equal exchange of value)

"I just wanted to have fun in my 20s" (I tried in vain to land a 9/10 guy, well out of my league, and got dumped dozens of times; I write off all those failed efforts and crying jags when they never called back, as 'fun' cause if I didn't, I would jump off a building)

"I'm not looking for players" (I've been played OFTEN)

Not all women are Carousel Riding sluts But those are have survived the carousel exist only to be subjects of mockery. They don't realize how everyone sees them: their Sexual Market Value (SMV)-equal men who simply observe their laughable mating strategy backfire OVER AND OVER AGAIN, even the men who bed them, add to their notch count, and delete their number from their phones have contempt for them. The male population laughs at them again when they come in desperation in their mid 30s - "would we be interested in marrying them?" Heck, even the government of China looks down on them.

A carousel rider hopes to hide her sexual history when she enters the marriage marketplace at a later age; but her words and attitudes give her away. She didn't just squander her sexual prime (15-29); she "learned" all the wrong lessons about relationships- that it's a game of power that they have to "win". She's had to use her bag of psychological tricks and offer pussy 24/7 just to stay afloat around alphas; pity the 30-something sexually inexperienced beta male who thinks he's found a 'mentallly mature' woman he can have a mutually respectful, trusting relationship with. He has entered a lifetime of psychological warfare with a resentful woman who has the exact wrong kind of relationship history.

I could give zero fucks about female dating problems, because they are generally self-inflicted. The root cause of the problem is that women are emotional creatures trying to win in a market that rewards rational decision making. A woman trying to navigate the Sexual Marketplace (SMP) is like a guy who wins million dollar lotto, cashes in his ticket and immediately goes to a high stakes poker game, leaving a few hours later broke and humiliated.

What would a rational female player in the SMP do? She'd seek commitment when she's young and her value is highest, she'd get an accurate assessment of her own value, bid within a reasonable value range and preserve her ability to pair bond by remaining chaste.

What do members of the YOLO sisterhood do nowadays? They follow shitty feminist advice and do the exact fucking opposite. They develop an inflated sense of their own value, give away their precious resource for free when it's at peak value, depress their market value by seeking buyers who have the least incentive to commit and attempt to cash in when their assets are almost fully depreciated.

It's almost pathetic, because it's like taking candy from a baby if you're an experienced player.

TL;DR - Make it your job as a man to look for the signs and avoid relationships with these baggage filled women who have been used and abused during their prime. they are good for nothing more then a blowjob.

Search for "Sex and Culture" by JD Unwin. He did a pretty large study on civilizations throughout history and found one thing in common with all of those who were once great and ultimately collapsed: unrestrained female sexuality.

title: Super Bowl Ads
text:
Isn't it a shame that companies will shed out $160,000 per second for a Super Bowl 50 commercial. That's per SECOND, or $4.8 million for a 30-second commercial. This is really sad as you and I could retire on only five seconds of their airtime. 

One could think that a corporation would massively expose themselves to the national media by stating that they gave their Super Bowl advertisement money to a small city. How about Pepsi? They'll run probably four commercials during the game which will cost them over 19 million dollars. 

Wouldn't it be better if the people in the U.S. were to hear over and over again through the news media that Pepsi gave six small cities in the U.S. $3.2 million each for own cause? They could use their own lottery system and pick six cities with populations under 80,000, and they could get a bigger tax write-off because of it also. I'd certainly buy a product from a corporation that does that.

That would certainly go a lot further for their own overall goals than some commercials during one three-hour television show.

I doubt that will happen as all the upper fat cats in those companies will each eat their lobster and caviar with fine wine during the game and boasting how, "This is my commercial!"

To those arrogant fat cats............................. big deal.

I have three major bias groups - BTS, Got7, and Day6. My ultimate bias is one Kim Namjoon. My top biases after that are Jackson and Jae.

I'm independent and have strong core values, such as honesty, integrity, loyalty, faithfulness, charity and love. I love adventure, traveling by car and by plane, exploring out of the way places and gaining value and knowledge by meeting interesting people and just learning in general. I naturally talk using "big words" as my friends say and it's not to impress or make you feel inferior, I've been doing it since age 17, it's just the way I communicate and I'm confident in asking questions and saying "I don't know" and am secure in my past relationships so if you have a tendency for jealousy or possessiveness, guarantee I'm not your lady. title: to the "not so manly" men
text:
At dinner time on a Friday night- Howe ave is a busy place. I'm trying to get to Mcdonalds to get a damn happy meal, and the right hand lane I'm in is not moving. I make it around, and see a younger male struggling to push another younger males mini-van, by himself. What do I do? a 30 something year old woman, alone, trying to get dinner for her three children at home. OF COURSE I pull over and help push. Because that is what I'm supposed to do- help out when help is needed. period. 

So why did all these cars just pass someone by that was in need? not a single man (which it absolutely should have been) and like i said...its dinner time, so there had to be 20+ cars drive around, and by- to see this person pushing alone, just in the few minutes it took me to get around, pull into Olive Garden and run down to help.

shame on you men. shame on you.

title: Tamir Rice
text:
I must say...I can not believe that these people do not understand the reasons that this young man was shot to death. It's strange that the only picture of him that the media shows is of him younger. 
Let me try to elaborate:
1) He was in a public park wielding what appeared to be a hand gun
2) When the police drove up, he immediately reached for it and started to remove it from his clothing.
3) He did not listen to their orders
4) His parent(s) did not teach this young man any common sense
5) His parent(s) did not supervise him and teach him right from wrong
6) The dispatcher should have communicated better with the cops what the caller said, but then again, if she had and the gun would have been real, she would have been scrutinized for that.
In my opinion the mother should be brought up on charges of child neglect....etc.
I guess maybe the cops should have just told dispatch to forget it....every thing was fine there and not try to look into it.....and what may have happened with innocent by-standers happen had this in fact been a real gun. Oh....and where the hell was the orange tip on the gun? I bet Mom didn't know about that either.
The people that are behind these protests, etc. are the type that are followers and can not think for themselves. We need new legislation that would seperate these peoples communities from the norm and they have take care of their own problems.....I think that resolve a lot of this asinine thinking.
Just in case you are still reading...Oh....and by the way, yes I am a 40 year old white male. Also, I really didn't proofread this....so if there are typing mistakes, so be it.
I bet Le bron really would like to say some of the things that I have said in this, but he can't because it may/would lower the cav's fan base and he's a member of this race. 
I really wish we could all get along.....maybe if half these "people" would really act like humans, things would go a lot better for them.
In my opinion, the young man didn't have the common sense of a 12 year old, and should not have been left in public unsupervised.

title: American survival tips
text:
*** The content of this post is not for everyone. If you don't/won't see that there is something fundamentally wrong about the new Amerika (not to mention western Europe), then just ignore this rant, go have a cappuccino or glass of wine and tune into your favorite mainstream news program or reality show, and tune out..."everything's fine" ***

For those of us who know that something is terribly wrong, and can't move to a tropical island or some off-the-grid wilderness...some tips on survival moving forward...

1.) Whether you have children or not, get involved in homeschooling. Take your children out of the public schools and teach them the basics. Some say that school is essential for learning socialization skills, but I disagree. The majority of my socializing took place with the neighbor kids (some of whom I am still friends with today - 40 years later) who lived around me. Much of what I dealt with in the public schools was boredom and bullies. Today they are nothing more that state propaganda centers. "Common core" is beyond farce. So gather with your neighbors of like mind, and help each other out with scheduling, curriculum, snacks, etc..

2.) Restrict television viewing to almost nil. The adults need to decide what is appropriate for the children to watch. Some movies and shows can be inspirational and instructive, but most are just garbage being churned out to brainwash the general public. Why do you think they call them "programs"?

3.) Limit access to the internet in a similar fashion. Get rid of smart phones, I-pads, cell phones, etc.; these devices are hypnotic, and there is still much that is unclear about the health effects from the electro-magnetic fields these devices emit.

4.) Get to know your neighbors. Have regular pot-luck dinners where you can gather to visit and converse about your concerns.

5.) Build a neighborhood organic garden, so that everyone can share in the maintenance, and bounty. If your city codes allow it, raise some livestock too (chickens, goats). Some bee hives are also a great idea.

6.) provide clean non-fluoridated water for your family with either in-home filtering systems, or a central commercial sized filtration system for the neighborhood. Do some research on the dangers of municipal water:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqstwfKGzPI

Equally as important to study up on is state sponsored vaccination programs:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K1m3TjokVU4


7.) Get to know LIKE-MINDED local law enforcement, and military personnel. This relationship can provide safety, security, and intelligence benefits. Politicians and bureaucrats are far less reliable. 

This is a place to start. You can develop your own particular plan that makes sense for your own neighborhood.

Remember...no matter what your age, race, ethnicity, socio-economic background, gender, religion, or gender preference...we need to stick together in order to navigate and thrive in the the growing mess that has become our nation.

One last note friends. Here is a link to an article that was written by someone who survived the communist dictatorship in the former soviet union. It offers some keen insights into our current predicament in Amerika.

http://www.freepressers.com/what-has-happened-to-the-west-and-its-men-the-hypnotic-dance-of-death/

Good luck, and god bless.

title: look no further
text:
Hey 
I'm Liz, I was born in Banner Elk, NC (the most beautiful place) I've lived in TN, NC, VA, AZ, PA, IL and WY some people might say that moving a lot is a bad thing but living that life as I grew up has taught me a lot of valuable lessons. It taught me how to be flexible, it has taught me to be comfortable in a lot of different situations and with all different types of people. I can eat at a fancy restaurant or at McDonalds and be comfortable. I grew up with kids from Korea and Kenya I ate their food and played games from their countries. This is one of the reasons why I have a very large world view 
Currently I'm a student of psychology at the university of Wyoming, I'm a bit of an over achiever I've got a 4.0 GPA and that's the way it's going to stay. I really enjoy studying human behavior but I'm changing my major to creative writing because that's what I have an aptitude for I believe. 
I come from a very well off family, my mom's a Chaplin, my sister a lawyer so my family taught me the importance of education and it has become very important to me. 
Another thing that's important in my life is travel, I was in Portland last week and it was awesome! I was so excited and it didn't disappoint. I've been to 8 countries and 33 states and counting! It's very important to me that the person I'm with feels that same way. 
Moving around a lot gave me this wanderlust which manifest's its self in spontaneous trips and plans of moving to Europe one day.
Also I'm pretty liberal, gay pride parades, prochoice etc... 
I love cats, if it was legal I'd marry one (just kidding) 
I bake, cook, hike, camp, tube, read (mostly romance, cook cooks, murder and I really love children stories) it helps keep my imagination strong. 
I love national parks I've been to Yellowstone a ton of times and it's fabulous! I want to visit more. 
Like I said, my mom's a minister, I'm Presbyterian but deciding if I want to be Christian or not it's deeper than that but that's what it comes down to. I do have a heart for service. Last year I was a missionary in Chicago, IL I worked with the Chicago Collison for the homeless, and an organization called play for peace which try to initiate peacemaking in inner city schools where violence is an issue. I worked at a school in Chicago that had a big problem with gang violence. I facilitated an after school club where we talked played games and we even went camping one weekend! I also tutored, part of my program was living intentionally in solidarity with the people around me. So I lived in with the people I served, I lived off a very small stipend and I took public transportation everywhere which I loved! So all this to say that I believe in social justice and taking an action in issues I care about. 
When it comes to a man I have pretty high standards! Intelligent, sweet, affectionate, respectful, honest, loves to travel! But what it comes down to is if we click we click! 
I recently moved back to Knoxville , I am and I'm very excited to be home!
